abstract: Amtrak officials say technical roadblocks and regulatory hurdles delayed operation of automatic speed control system that might have prevented crash of train that derailed in Philadelphia; despite delays, wireless system may have been just months from being operational.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JAD MOUAWAD
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington and Jad Mouawad from New York; Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The railroad said technical and regulatory roadblocks had delayed operation of the system, which might have prevented this week’s train derailment.

headline.main: Amtrak Says Shortfalls and Rules Delayed Its Safety System
headline.print_headline: Hurdles Stalled Safety System, Railroad Says
